intro: Pseudocyclosorus tibeticus, commonly known as the Tibetan false chain fern, is a rare and unique member of the Hymenophyllum family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This plant thrives in the cool, moist environments of the Himalayan region, particularly in the high-altitude forests of Tibet. Its leaves are usually densely packed and exhibit a distinct, glossy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
